name: LambdaDeployFunction
description: General purpose deployment of AWS Lambda functions for all supported language runtimes.
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [AWS Lambda Developer Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/) for more information on working with AWS Lambda.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS credentials to use. If needed, click on 'Manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'.

inputs.name: regionName
inputs.label: AWS Region
inputs.helpMarkDown: AWS region name, please check https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html.

inputs.name: deploymentMode
inputs.label: Deployment Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Selects the type of deployment. You can deploy new function code to an existing function or you can specify settings for both code and configuration. For the 'code and configuration' mode if the function does not exist it will be created.

options.codeandconfiguration: Update code and configuration (or create a new function)

inputs.name: functionName
inputs.label: Function Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Lambda function to create or update. You can also specify the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function.

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: A short, user-defined function description. Lambda does not use this value. Assign a meaningful description as you see fit.

inputs.name: functionHandler
inputs.label: Function Handler
inputs.helpMarkDown: The function within your code that Lambda calls to begin execution. For Node.js, it is the module-name.export value in your function. For Java, it can be package.class-name::handler or package.class-name. For more information, see [Programming Model](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/programming-model-v2.html)

inputs.name: runtime
inputs.label: Runtime
inputs.helpMarkDown: The runtime environment for the Lambda function you are uploading.

inputs.name: codeLocation
inputs.label: Code Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source of the code for the function. You can select a zip file in the work area or a zip file previously uploaded to Amazon S3.

options.localfile: Zip file in the work area

inputs.name: localZipFile
inputs.label: Zip File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the zip file containing the function code to deploy. Required if Deployment Source is set to 'Zip file in the work area'.

inputs.name: s3Bucket
inputs.label: S3 Bucket Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the bucket containing the previously uploaded zip file of the function's code. Required if Deployment Source is set to 'Zip file in Amazon S3'.

inputs.name: s3ObjectKey
inputs.label: S3 Object Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The key (name) of the object in the bucket containing the function's code.  Required if Deployment Source is set to 'Zip file in Amazon S3'.

inputs.name: s3ObjectVersion
inputs.label: S3 Object Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of the S3 object containing the function code (optional)

inputs.name: roleARN
inputs.label: Role ARN or Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN), or name, of the IAM role that Lambda assumes when it executes your function to access any other Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources. If a role name is supplied the task will attempt to retrieve the ARN automatically.

inputs.name: memorySize
inputs.label: Memory Size
inputs.helpMarkDown: The amount of memory, in MB, your Lambda function is given. Lambda uses this memory size to infer the amount of CPU and memory allocated to your function. Your function use-case determines your CPU and memory requirements. For example, a database operation might need less memory compared to an image processing function. The default value is 128 MB. The value must be a multiple of 64 MB.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The function execution time at which Lambda should terminate the function. Because the execution time has cost implications, we recommend you set this value based on your expected execution time. The default is 3 seconds.

inputs.name: publish
inputs.label: Publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set, requests AWS Lambda to create or update the Lambda function and publish a version as an atomic operation.

inputs.name: deadLetterARN
inputs.label: Dead Letter ARN
inputs.helpMarkDown: The target ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

inputs.name: kmsKeyARN
inputs.label: KMS Key ARN
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt your function's environment variables. If not provided, AWS Lambda will use a default service key.

inputs.name: environment
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: The key-value pairs that represent your environment's configuration settings. Enter as Name=Value, one per line.

inputs.name: tags
inputs.label: Tags
inputs.helpMarkDown: The list of tags (key-value pairs) assigned to the new function. Enter as Key=Value, one per line. Tags can only be specified when creating a new function and are ignored when updating functions.

inputs.name: securityGroups
inputs.label: Security Group IDs
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of security group IDs, one per line. If your Lambda function accesses resources in a VPC at least one security group and one subnet ID must be specified, which must belong to the same VPC.

inputs.name: subnets
inputs.label: Subnet IDs
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of subnet IDs, one per line. If your Lambda function accesses resources in a VPC at least one security group and one subnet ID must be specified, which must belong to the same VPC.

inputs.name: tracingConfig
inputs.label: Tracing Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Trace settings for your function.

options.Active: Respect any tracing header received from an upstream service
options.PassThrough: Only trace the request from an upstream service if it contains a tracing header with 'sampled=1'

inputs.name: outputVariable
inputs.label: Output Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the variable that will contain the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created or updated function on task completion. The variable can be used as $(variableName) to refer to the function result in subsequent tasks.

inputs.name: logRequest
inputs.label: Log Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, request headers and other data for calls to AWS services are logged to the task's debug log.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Log Response
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the response metadata and body content of non-streaming responses from calls to AWS services are output to the task's debug log. The unique request ID, which can be useful when contacting AWS for support, is always logged to the task output regardless of this option setting.

messages.FunctionNotFound: Function %s does not exist, cannot update code only
messages.TaskCompleted: Completed create or update of Lambda function %s, function ARN %s
